properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong westerly winds will develop overnight and gust near 90 km/h by early Sunday morning. Winds will then increase throughout the day, gusting upwards of 120 km/h by late Sunday evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-21T19:40:59-00:00

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong westerly winds gusting between 90 and 100 km/h will develop this morning in the Jasper region and by noon in the Banff region, including the HWY 93 corridor. These strong winds will begin to diminish late this evening, however winds gusting near 70 km/h can be expected to persist into Monday. HWY 93: snowfall is expected along the southern section of Highway 93 today, intensifying this evening and persisting until Monday evening. This snowfall combined with strong gusty winds will reduce visibility at times in blowing snow. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-22T03:46:36-00:00

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of pollutants are expected and will result in poor air quality. High concentrations of pollutants are expected to continue until early Sunday morning. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. In Quebec, wood heating is the main source of fine particles that contribute to smog during winter. This activity generates the largest number of these particulates, more than industrial activities and transportation. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-02-21T16:59:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2021-02-21T02:21:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4017762677.2021
Area: La Sarre area, Amos area, Lebel-sur-Quévillon area, Senneterre area, Rouyn area, Malartic area, Val d'Or - Louvicourt area

properties.Summary:

Strong southwest winds will give reduced visibility in blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Extreme cold wind chill values near minus 50 this morning will moderate and end this afternoon. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow changing to heavy rain with the potential for heavy snow at the summit for tonight. A frontal system laden with subtropical moisture will move across southern B.C. today through Monday morning bringing a messy mix of rain on top of snow today and the possibility of heavy wet snow at the summit tonight into Monday morning. The initial warm front will raise snow levels today with snow still falling on the upper elevations of the Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt and Highway 3 via Allison Pass. By tonight, the warm airmass will be over southern B.C. with snow levels near or slightly above the Coquihalla Summit and Allison Pass. Rain will fall over most of the highway with wet snow or rain mixed with snow near at summit. As the cold front approaches tonight, precipitation rates will intensify and thus there is potential for snow levels to drop just below the summit or pass levels. Total snow accumulations near 25 cm can be expected near the summit level by Monday morning. Motorists are advised to be aware of changing weather and road conditions due to fluctuating snow levels and precipitation intensity during this period. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-22T05:17:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-21T13:18:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1071124344.2021
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt
properties.Author: Environment Canada
